data.title: Q&A: John Cleese
data.meta_description: 'The worst thing anyone's ever said to me? "Are you Michael Palin?"'
data.text:
John Cleese, 72, was born in Weston-super-Mare. At Cambridge University, he studied law and joined the Footlights, where he met Graham Chapman. In the late 60s, he formed the Monty Python troupe with Chapman, Eric Idle, Michael Palin, Terry Jones and Terry Gilliam. Cleese went on to further success as Basil Fawlty in Fawlty Towers, which he wrote with his then wife, Connie Booth. In 1988, Cleese wrote and starred in the hit movie, A Fish Called Wanda. His latest film, Spud, is out on DVD. Cleese recently married for the fourth time and lives in Monaco.

When were you happiest?

There are different kinds of happiness, but the simplest was when I was 13 because what one had to do was so obvious.

What is your greatest fear?

Lack of meaning.

Which living person do you most admire, and why?

Michael Frayn – such modesty, talent, kindness and bottomless curiosity.

What is the trait you most deplore in yourself?

Cowardice. I have several times made a poor choice by avoiding a necessary confrontation.

What is the trait you most deplore in others?

Lack of kindness.

Property aside, what's the most expensive thing you've bought?

A trip down the Nile for 45 friends.

What is your most treasured possession?

A teddy bear that belonged to Genghis Khan.

What do you most dislike about your appearance?

The signs of the approach of death.

If you could bring something extinct back to life, what would you choose?

Dad, Peter Cook, David Hatch and Harry Secombe.

What is your favourite book?

Confessions Of A Philosopher, by Bryan Magee.

Where would you like to live?

I'm still trying to work that out.

What would be your fancy dress costume of choice?

Jeans and a cotton polo shirt, or a Hungarian Hussar's uniform.

What is the worst thing anyone's ever said to you?

Are you Michael Palin?

Cat or dog?

I'm a vegetarian (according to Wikipedia, which is wrong) so… cat.

What is your guiltiest pleasure?

Assisting at major surgeries.

What do you owe your parents?

£182.07.

To whom would you most like to say sorry, and why?

My dad. I was once very unkind to him. Sorry, Dad.

What was the best kiss of your life?

MYOB. Anyway, it's dead now.

Have you ever said 'I love you' and not meant it?

Only once (to Jeffrey Archer).

Which living person do you most despise, and why?

Murdoch. He did irreparable damage to English culture.

Which words or phrases do you most overuse?

Gynaecological ones.

What single thing would improve the quality of your life?

More energy.

What song would you like played at your funeral?

Tchaikovsky's 1812, sung by Barry Manilow.

How would you like to be remembered?

As John Cleese.

Tell us a joke.

A grasshopper hops into a bar and on to a stool. The bartender says, "We've got a drink named after you." The grasshopper says, "What, Norman?"
